bonuses.leadin: A slow resting heart rate is part of Cushing's triad that occurs in response to an increase in this quantity. For 10 points each:

parts: Name this quantity, which can be lowered to normal levels by a shunt procedure or lumbar puncture.
Lumbar punctures lower intracranial pressure by removing this substance from the body. The arachnoid mater (“mah-tur”) and the pia mater (“mah-tur”) are the two meninges that surround this substance.
This Greek physician may have been the first to identify cerebrospinal fluid, writing on "water surrounding the brain." His namesake oath begins "first, do no harm."

Caroline Lamb parodied Byron's writing style in a poem titled for a "New" version of this poetic structure, which was referred to as fitt in Old English. This poetic structure also titles a long, modernist poetic work partly written from a Pisan prison.
answers_formatted: Lamb [accept Lady Caroline Lamb or Charles Lamb or Mary Lamb]

Both "Neptune, the Mystic" and "Mars, the Bringer of War" are in this unusual time signature. The second movement of Tchaikovsky's Pathétique Symphony has a "limping waltz" in this time signature.

This elusive material provides much of the mass needed to explain the nature of galactic rotation but does not interact with light, making it difficult to study.

bonuses.leadin: After his wife leaves him, a member of this family ends up cutting off three of Pedro Tercero's ("ter-SAIRoh's") fingers. For 10 points each:
answers: Uruguay [or Oriental Republic of the Uruguay]
parts: Name this fictional family who live at the estancía ("ess-TAN-see-ah") Las Tres Marías. In The House of the Spirits, this family's member Esteban marries Clara del Valle ("VIE-ay") rather than Rosa the Beautiful.
Pedro Tercero's fingers are cut off in this Chilean author's novel The House of the Spirits.

Four children cut off their sister's head in "The Decapitated Chicken," a horror story by this country's author Horacio Quiroga ("oh-RASS-ee-oh kee-ROH-gah"). In 1973, Allende fled Chile with a copy of Open Veins of Latin America, a book by this country's author Eduardo Galeano ("gal-ay-AH-noh").

bonuses.leadin: A grotesque terracotta caricature of Hippolyte Abraham Dubois is part of this artist's Célébrités du Juste Milieu series. For 10 points each:
answers: Honoré Daumier [or Honoré-Victorin Daumier] (the painting is The Third-Class Carriage)
King of France [or King of the French; or French monarch] (the Rigaud portrait was of Louis XIV)
playing chess [prompt on answers like playing a board game]
parts: Name this French artist. A working-class woman holds a sleeping child next to an older woman carrying a basket in the foreground of an 1863 painting by this artist.

Daumier was arrested for an unflattering lithograph of a holder of this office sucking up the country's riches. Hyacinthe Rigaud painted a lavish portrait of an earlier holder of this office wearing a coat decorated with fleurs de lys.
An old man looks down at the table in a Daumier painting of this activity. Marcel Duchamp stopped making art to focus on this activity.
answers_formatted: King of France [or King of the French; or French monarch]
playing chess [prompt on answers like playing a board game]
metadata: the painting is The Third-Class Carriage
the Rigaud portrait was of Louis XIV

bonuses.leadin: The San Blas Islands off the north coast of this country remain under the semi-autonomous control of its Kuna people. For 10 points each:
answers: artificial island [or artificial archipelago; or man-made islands or ground fill islands or land fill islands or islands made from land reclamation or answers like that; prompt on islands or archipelago or artificial cities or artificial land formations]
parts: Identify this country whose port of Cristóbal once had a large foreign community and an artillery post called Fort De Lesseps.
Many of the wealthiest Panamanians live on one of these structures near Panama City called Ocean Reef. Other examples of these structures include The World off the coast of Dubai.

The Ocean Flower artificial island project off the coast of this Chinese province is slated to host no fewer than 28 museums. This province is the both the southernmost and least populous of China's provinces.
answers_formatted: artificial island [or artificial archipelago; or man-made islands or ground fill islands or land fill islands or islands made from land reclamationor answers like that; prompt on islands or archipelago or artificial cities or artificial land formations]

bonuses.leadin: Because these items required an extreme amount of fabric to create, they were seen by some as wasteful and extravagant during a time of war. For 10 points each:
answers: Zoot Suits [accept Zoot Suit riots; prompt on suits]
parts: Identify these articles of clothing popular among Black and Latino youth in the 1930s. Men wearing these clothes were targeted in a namesake 1943 riot.
The Zoot Suit riots took place in this city, where racial tensions erupted during the 1992 Rodney King riots.
Los Angeles's Latino population grew greatly in the 1940s thanks to this federal program. Harlon Carter and Joseph Swing forcibly deported this program's participants in the 1950s.

bonuses.leadin: Dissolving a mesogen in a solvent can produce the "lyotropic" type of these materials, which are contrasted with their "thermotropic" type. For 10 points each:
answers: liquid crystals [accept lyotropic liquid crystals or thermotropic liquid crystals]
parts: Name these materials which, despite having long-range order, still flow somewhat freely. They are the "LC" in "LCD displays."
LCD displays often use liquid crystals in this phase, which is contrasted with the smectic phase. In this phase, rod-like molecules have long-range orientational order, but not positional order.
Liquid crystals exhibit this anisotropic property, in which they have different indices of refraction depending on the direction of incident light.
answers_formatted: liquid crystals [accept lyotropic liquid crystals or thermotropic liquid crystals]

bonuses.leadin: This author's stock character of the lustful old man, or senex amator, is exemplified by Lysidamus from his play Casina. For 10 points each:
answers: slaves [or enslaved people or clear equivalents; or servus or manicipium]
Menaechmi ("men-IKE-me") [or The Brothers Menaechmus or The Twins Menaechmus or The Two Menaechmuses]
parts: Name this Roman playwright of The Pot of Gold and Miles ("MEE-lez") Gloriosus.
Plautus' stock characters include a "clever" one of these people. The writers Terence and Aesop were both this type of person before they were manumitted.
A slave called Messenio gets embroiled in a series of confusions concerning the title identical twins in this play by Plautus, which was the basis for Shakespeare's A Comedy of Errors.

bonuses.leadin: These structures shrink in response to abscisic acid. For 10 points each:
parts: Name these cells which bend when they are turgid, which occurs after the entry of potassium ions in response to phototropin activation.
The size of guard cells determine whether or not one of these pores found in leaves are opened or closed.
The process of water's motion through a plant and diffusion through the stomata is given this name.
